channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [BEANUTILS-477] Warnings from FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector when creating a CombinedConfiguration from a CombinedConfigurationBuilder
item.description:
When creating a CombinedConfiguration from a CombinedConfigurationBuilder we get a number of warnings from FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector whilst it's trying to get PropertyDescriptors for the following methods: AbstractConfiguration.setProperty and MultiWrapDynaBean.set.

Is there a way to suppress these warnings or some other fix, as our testers keep reporting the warnings as errors.

The following is a simple example of the code that should reproduce this issue:


    @Test

    public void configurationTestExample() {

        List<FileLocationStrategy> subs = Arrays.asList(

                new ProvidedURLLocationStrategy(),

                new FileSystemLocationStrategy(),

                new ClasspathLocationStrategy());

        FileLocationStrategy strategy = new CombinedLocationStrategy(subs);

        

        Parameters params = new Parameters();

        CombinedConfigurationBuilder builder = new CombinedConfigurationBuilder()

            .configure(

                    params.fileBased()

                        .setFile(new File("Configuration.unitTest.xml"))

                        .setLocationStrategy(strategy)

                        .setListDelimiterHandler(new DefaultListDelimiterHandler(';'))

                    );



        try {

            CombinedConfiguration config = builder.getConfiguration();

            config.hashCode();

        } catch (org.apache.commons.configuration2.ex.ConfigurationException e) {

            e.printStackTrace();

        }

        

        assertTrue(true);

    }

and here is the stack trace


16:16:54,037  WARN xxx:[main] (FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector.java:146) - Error when creating PropertyDescriptor for public final void org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.setProperty(java.lang.String,java.lang.Object)! Ignoring this property.

java.beans.IntrospectionException: bad write method arg count: public final void org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.setProperty(java.lang.String,java.lang.Object)

and finally, here is the Configuration.unitTest.xml


<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1" ?>



<configuration>

	<header>

		<result throwExceptionOnMissing="true"/>

	</header>



	<!-- properties for the unit tests -->

	<properties fileName="unitTest.properties" throwExceptionOnMissing="true" config-name="properties">

		<listDelimiterHandler

        	config-class="org.apache.commons.configuration2.convert.DefaultListDelimiterHandler">

        	<config-constrarg config-value=";"/>

      	</listDelimiterHandler>

	</properties>



</configuration>
item.summary: Warnings from FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector when creating a CombinedConfiguration from a CombinedConfigurationBuilder

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This log message is indeed a bit annoying, but the cause of the problem lies in Commons BeanUtils. FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector should probably ignore set methods with more than one argument.

I would propose moving this ticket to BeanUtils. However, this project is currently pretty dormant and it is unlikely that there will be a release soon.

Many thanks for getting back to us on this issue. For now we're hiding the warnings that are getting logged by the FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector, but this isn't ideal.

If you could move this ticket to BeanUtils that would be great, as you say it really belongs there.

Again many thanks.

Ticket was moved to BeanUtils.

The only work-around I currently see is indeed to change the logging configuration so that these logs are suppressed.

Oliver, Appreciate your help if you could provide logging configuration which needs to be changed. I am using beta 2.0 commons-configuration library and this warning is so annoying.

My piece of code:
private INIConfiguration config = null;
FileBasedConfigurationBuilder<INIConfiguration> builder = new FileBasedConfigurationBuilder<INIConfiguration>(INIConfiguration.class)
.configure(params.hierarchical().setFileName(this.filePath).setExpressionEngine(engine));

config = builder.getConfiguration();

We added the following to our log4j.properties file, and it made the warning (and I guess others), go away:

log4j.logger.org.apache.commons.beanutils=ERROR

Changed log level from WARN to INFO. The exception stacktrace is only logged on DEBUG level.

Fixed in SVN in revision 1746622.

Oliver Heger, any ETA on 1.9.3 release. I need this fix too, this happened with me too when using CompositeConfiguration.

Jun 16, 2016 10:24:27 AM org.apache.commons.beanutils.FluentPropertyBeanIntrospector introspect

WARNING: Error when creating PropertyDescriptor for public final void org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.setProperty(java.lang.String,java.lang.Object)! Ignoring this property.

java.beans.IntrospectionException: bad write method arg count: public final void org.apache.commons.configuration2.AbstractConfiguration.setProperty(java.lang.String,java.lang.Object)

	at java.beans.PropertyDescriptor.findPropertyType(PropertyDescriptor.java:657)

There has already been a first release candidate, but during vote a problem with Java 1.8 has been detected. This is currently investigated. So, no concrete ETA, but hopefully 1.9.3 will come out soon.
Oliver Heger, Looking at the release history 1.9.3 seems long due
Raviteja Lokineni the 1.9.3 release is blocked by BEANUTILS-492
